name: Classic Margherita Pizza
instructions: Preheat the oven to 475°F (245°C).
Roll out the pizza dough to the desired size.
Spread a thin layer of tomato sauce on the dough.
Top with fresh mozzarella slices and basil leaves.
Drizzle olive oil and bake for 10-12 minutes.

name: Butter Chicken
instructions: Marinate the chicken with yogurt, spices, and lemon juice for 1 hour.
Cook the chicken in a hot pan until lightly browned.
Prepare a tomato-based sauce with butter, cream, and spices.
Simmer the chicken in the sauce for 20 minutes.

name: Paneer Tikka Masala
instructions: Marinate paneer cubes in yogurt, spices, and lemon juice.
Grill the paneer until lightly charred.
Prepare a rich tomato-based curry with spices and cream.
Add the grilled paneer cubes to the curry and cook for 10 minutes.

name: Aloo Gobi
instructions: Heat oil in a pan and sauté onions and ginger-garlic paste.
Add turmeric, coriander, and red chili powder.
Add potatoes and cauliflower florets and mix well.
Cover and cook on low heat until tender.
Garnish with fresh cilantro.

name: Masala Dosa
instructions: Prepare dosa batter using rice and urad dal.
Make a potato filling with onions, mustard seeds, and turmeric.
Spread the batter on a hot griddle to form a thin crepe.
Add the potato filling and fold the dosa.
Serve with coconut chutney and sambar.

name: Chicken Biryani
instructions: Marinate chicken with yogurt and spices for 2 hours.
Cook basmati rice until 70% done.
Layer rice and chicken in a pot with fried onions and saffron milk.
Cook on low heat (dum) for 30 minutes.

name: Palak Paneer
instructions: Blanch spinach and blend into a smooth puree.
Sauté onions, garlic, and ginger in a pan.
Add spices and the spinach puree.
Add paneer cubes and cook for 10 minutes.

name: Dal Makhani
instructions: Soak black lentils and kidney beans overnight.
Cook them in a pressure cooker with water and salt.
Prepare a rich tomato-based curry with cream and butter.
Add the cooked lentils and simmer for 30 minutes.

name: Chole Bhature
instructions: Cook chickpeas with spices and onion-tomato gravy.
Prepare a dough with maida, yogurt, and baking powder.
Roll out and deep fry to make bhature.
Serve hot with chole.

name: Rasgulla
instructions: Prepare chenna by curdling milk.
Knead the chenna into a smooth dough and shape into balls.
Cook the balls in sugar syrup until they double in size.
Cool and serve chilled.

name: Rajma Masala
instructions: Soak kidney beans overnight and cook them until tender.
Prepare a tomato-based gravy with spices.
Add the cooked beans and simmer for 20 minutes.

name: Kheer
instructions: Cook rice in milk until soft.
Add sugar, cardamom, and saffron.
Garnish with nuts and raisins.

name: Pani Puri
instructions: Prepare puris using semolina and deep-fry them.
Make a spicy and tangy water using tamarind, mint, and spices.
Prepare a potato and chickpea filling.
Assemble by stuffing the puris with filling and serving with flavored water.

name: Dhokla
instructions: Prepare a batter using gram flour, yogurt, and spices.
Steam the batter until fluffy.
Temper with mustard seeds, curry leaves, and green chilies.
Cut into pieces and serve.

name: Baingan Bharta
instructions: Roast eggplants until soft and peel the skin.
Mash the eggplants and cook with onions, tomatoes, and spices.
Garnish with fresh coriander and serve.

name: Lassi
instructions: Blend yogurt, sugar, and water until frothy.
Add a pinch of cardamom powder.
Serve chilled, garnished with nuts.

name: Malai Kofta
instructions: Prepare kofta balls using mashed potatoes, paneer, and spices, then deep-fry.
Make a rich gravy using tomatoes, cream, and cashews.
Add the kofta balls to the gravy before serving.

name: Pav Bhaji
instructions: Boil and mash vegetables like potatoes, peas, and carrots.
Cook the mashed vegetables with onions, tomatoes, and pav bhaji masala.
Serve hot with buttered pav (bread rolls).

name: Samosa
instructions: Prepare a dough using all-purpose flour and water.
Make a filling with spiced mashed potatoes and peas.
Shape the dough into cones, fill them, and seal.
Deep-fry until golden and crisp.

name: Kadai Paneer
instructions: Cook paneer cubes with bell peppers and onions in a spicy tomato-based gravy.
Add freshly ground coriander and red chilies for flavor.
Serve hot with naan or rice.

name: Idli
instructions: Prepare a batter using fermented rice and urad dal.
Pour the batter into idli molds and steam for 10 minutes.
Serve hot with coconut chutney and sambar.

name: Pongal
instructions: Cook rice and moong dal together with spices.
Temper with ghee, curry leaves, and black pepper.
Garnish with cashews and serve hot.

name: Aloo Paratha
instructions: Prepare a dough using wheat flour, water, and a pinch of salt.
Make a spicy potato filling with boiled potatoes, spices, and coriander.
Roll out the dough, stuff with potato filling, and seal.
Cook on a tawa with ghee until golden brown.

name: Hyderabadi Biryani
instructions: Marinate chicken with yogurt, spices, and fried onions.
Cook partially boiled basmati rice with whole spices.
Layer the marinated chicken and rice, and cook on low heat.
Garnish with fried onions and fresh coriander.

name: Gulab Jamun
instructions: Prepare a dough with khoya, flour, and milk.
Shape into small balls and deep-fry until golden brown.
Soak the fried balls in sugar syrup flavored with cardamom and rose water.

name: Matar Paneer
instructions: Cook paneer cubes and green peas in a spiced tomato-onion gravy.
Simmer until the peas are soft.
Garnish with fresh coriander and serve with rice or roti.

name: Masala Dosa
instructions: Prepare dosa batter using fermented rice and urad dal.
Cook thin crepes on a tawa.
Make a potato masala filling with spices and onions.
Fill the dosa with potato masala and serve with chutney and sambar.

name: Chole Bhature
instructions: Cook chickpeas in a spiced tomato-based curry.
Prepare a dough for bhature using all-purpose flour and yogurt.
Deep-fry the bhature until puffed and golden.
Serve hot with chole, onion rings, and pickle.

name: Rasgulla
instructions: Prepare chhena (cottage cheese) by curdling milk.
Knead the chhena and shape into balls.
Cook the balls in sugar syrup until soft and spongy.

name: Vegetable Pulao
instructions: Cook basmati rice with mixed vegetables and whole spices.
Sauté with onions, ginger, and garlic.
Garnish with fried onions and serve hot.
